CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Emergency Medical Center?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Emergency Medical Center is arc {Rehabilitation Center}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc Emergency Medical Center?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc Emergency Medical Center is arc {Rural Township Clinic}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Rural Township Clinic} has the largest output flow.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Emergency Medical Center} has the largest input flow.

VE.Q: What is the flow value from Rehabilitation Center to Emergency Medical Center in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Rural Township Clinic to Emergency Medical Center in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Emergency Medical Center to Rural Township Clinic in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Emergency Medical Center and Rural Township Clinic in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Emergency Medical Center and Rural Township Clinic is {850}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between Rehabilitation Center and Emergency Medical Center in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between Rehabilitation Center and Emergency Medical Center is {137}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value in the chord chart?
What is the minimum flow value in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from Rural Township Clinic?
SC.A: The total flow output from Rural Township Clinic is {1072}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by Rural Township Clinic?
SC.A: The total flow input by Rural Township Clinic is {691}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 631? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {850} from {Rural Township Clinic} to {Emergency Medical Center}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 153? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {137} from {Emergency Medical Center} to {Rehabilitation Center}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 153 and 345? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {278} from {Rehabilitation Center} to {Rural Township Clinic}, a flow of {222} from {Rural Township Clinic} to {Rehabilitation Center}, a flow of {169} from {Rehabilitation Center} to {Emergency Medical Center}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Emergency Medical Center to Rehabilitation Center or from Rural Township Clinic to Emergency Medical Center?
NC.A: The flow from {Rural Township Clinic} to {Emergency Medical Center} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Rehabilitation Center to Emergency Medical Center, from Emergency Medical Center to Rural Township Clinic, or from Rural Township Clinic to Rehabilitation Center?
NC.A: The flow from {Emergency Medical Center} to {Rural Township Clinic} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Rural Township Clinic}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Emergency Medical Center} and {Rural Township Clinic}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc Rehabilitation Center, Arc Rural Township Clinic, Arc Emergency Medical Center}.
